page.title: 02Young Ornitholgist: FINTRY
page.content:
I started to become interested in {birdwatching}when I was 9 years old. Most often I go at weekends in summer. I set off at 5.30am to 7.0am and I'm usually back by lunch time.
I wear walking boots and carry a bag with my snack, notebook, pencil and waterproofs. Round my neck I carry my binoculars.
My usual places for birdwatching are the Carron Reservoir, the Endrick, the Lade and Culcreuch Woods. I use my notebook to write a small piece and draw a rough sketch of what I've seen.
My favourite birds are great crested grebes, redshanks, tree creepers and buzzards. One of the best sightings this year was the kingfisher, which I saw by the Endrick. I am now eleven.
